intro: Euphrasia hirtella var. eglandulosa, commonly known as the glandless eyebright, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, woodland environments and thrives in partial to full shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Euphrasia hirtella var. eglandulosa is often found in the eastern United States and is valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
